channel.title: [Help] How to change the client text colour ? [Help]
channel.description:
Ok on the client wen it loads it has the red loading bar that says unpacking text and data and etc. and loading maps.
how do you change the colour of that ?
i know the code if stuff like #FF0000 etc but wat class file is it in ?
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2zowtxs.png[/img]
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ THIS
Burgess[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 28, 2009, 02:54:57 am[/size][hr]Ok i have changed both the texts :)
how do uu change the bar ?

item.title: [Help] How to change the client text colour ? [Help]
item.dc:creator: @burg355 burg355
item.description:
@burg355 wrote:

How do you change it though i cant find the code for the colour bar.

Read full topic
item.source: [Help] How to change the client text colour ? [Help]

item.title: [Help] How to change the client text colour ? [Help]
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“johno2, post:4, topic:285845”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=378036.msg2844893#msg2844893 date=1246214657]

Thats the cache (I think) just uses Tom’s cache suite.

Yea, its not the cache though. It is client sided yes, but also within the .java files themselves. Sorry in no help further on that but i personally never tried to change it.
[/quote]

It is the cache because the bar moving is cached, thats why if you have no cache the client wont load…[/quote]
It doesn’t load because it’s missing the cache files, the bar colour is in the .java files.

Read full topic
item.source: [Help] How to change the client text colour ? [Help]

item.title: [Help] How to change the client text colour ? [Help]
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:3, topic:285845”][quote author=johno2 link=topic=378036.msg2844700#msg2844700 date=1246206487]
Thats the cache (I think) just uses Tom’s cache suite.
[/quote]
Yea, its not the cache though. It is client sided yes, but also within the .java files themselves. Sorry in no help further on that but i personally never tried to change it.[/quote]

It is the cache because the bar moving is cached, thats why if you have no cache the client wont load…

Read full topic
